result.execSummary:
The defendant Curmisha Patrice Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges to apply for work.

No contact with all Macy's Stores locations.

Defendant is to provide a DNA sample.
Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

timeConds.notes: To be used at the discretion of the agent with Huber privileges for Work.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Curmisha Patrice Davis

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Curmisha Patrice Davis in court.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court for Curmisha Patrice Davis.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 7 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 0 DAYS time served. Huber privileges to apply for work.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
- Serve 60 DAYS of condition time in the House of Correction imposed and stayed to be used at the discretion of the agent with Huber privileges for Work. 
- No violations that rise to the level of probable cause.
- No contact with all Macy's Stores locations.
- Maintain full-time employment.

- Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Defendant is to provide a DNA sample.

APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instructions, filed.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 31st, 2022

Defendant Curmisha Patrice Davis in court.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court for Curmisha Patrice Davis.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Discussion held. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.
Case adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Curmisha Patrice Davis in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Curmisha Patrice Davis appeared by video means with Attorney.
Defense counsel has received discovery and has not received an offer and requests additional time to review.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Curmisha Patrice Davis in court.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant appears without counsel.  
Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Court held colloquy with defendant. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed attorney Christopher Ertl, upon his acceptance, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $30.00 per month, starting 11/01/2022, and continuing the first of each month until all fees and expenses are paid.  Court advised defendant that failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Indigency hearing on June 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Curmisha Patrice Davis in court.  Fate Kristina McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Curmisha Patrice Davis appeared by video. Defendant loss her zoom connection on three occasions. Matter adjourned for indigency hearing in Branch 37.  Indigency hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with All Macy's Department Stores in Milwaukee County
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Curmisha Patrice Davis in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Curmisha Patrice Davis not in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Initial appearance on May 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Curmisha Patrice Davis
Current: 7108 W Grantosa Drive, Milwaukee, WI 53218   (Effective: 05-03-2022)
Prior: 3268 North 40th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/17/2022@2:30pm
